poem:
### Sensation's Silence

In the quiet of the flesh,  
the echo of youth fades,  
a desolate organ, unresponding  
to the touch of time's partners.  
Beyond false labors of ecstasy,  
lies an aging symphony,  
where the body, a lone violin,  
plays its mute requiem  
in the chamber's stillness.  
Yearning for the whisper  
of authentic joy once more.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "I have lost sensation in my penis - and long to orgasm with a partner I am a 64-year-old single man and have had more than 30 sexual partners in the 15 years since my divorce. However, I haven’t achieved orgasm by any means other than masturbation in years. It doesn’t matter what my partners try, I can’t climax, and I frequently fake orgasms because they get frustrated and I get tired. I was diagnosed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
